Package com.weapons

  • Interface Summary
    Interface Description
    WeaponInterface
    weapon interface to set the standard of the weapons
  • Class Summary
    Class Description
    AirVehicle
    AirVehicle class extends Vehicle
    FireBulletWeapon
    FireBulletWeapon class set bullet goes in same direction as weapons bullet travels fast and is small (you pick speed, size) bullet must collide exactly with other vehicles, to reduce their health by 10%
    FireSonicWaveWeapon
    class FireSonicWaveWeapon sonic goes in same direction as weapons sonic wave travels slow, and is large (you pick speed, size) sonic wave can collide with other vehicles, reduce their health by 5%
    InTheAirChimneyBlastWeapon
    class InTheAirChimneyBlastWeapon blows a area directly above with a straight up blast blast starts in this vehicles location, going up wit a radius that you choose.
    LandVehicle
    LandVehicle class extends Vehicle
    Main
    main class
    MyPanel
    class MyPanel
    MyVehicle
    class MyVehicle Connect one weapons to the keyboard and/or mouse for firing weapons (or get weapons to fire at random times) process a weapons strike on a weapons ...
    Position
    current position for weapons
    RearDefenseMineWeapon
    class RearDefenseMineWeapon mine is stationary, at the place weapons left it.
    Size
    current position for weapons
    Vehicle
    parent weapons class
    Weapon
    class Weapon collect all weapons
  • Enum Summary

    enum data for Direction
    Pedal
    GAS or BRAKE

    GAS or BRAKE
    WeaponType
    GAS or BRAKE
The class diagram of M03 - Weapons by Interface
class diagram
My Application of this concept
acronym Concept My Application of this concept
S SRP
Single responsibility principle
 Enum direction class have responsibility over a single part of that program's move functionality
O OCP
Open/closed principle
 The implementation of the Vehicle class is relatively simple. It just has a constructor, a public method to add position, and a method that brews a direction, so on.
L LSP
Liskov substitution principle
 The most effective way I have seen to illustrate this point was in LSP.
I ISP
Interface segregation principle
 the interface-segregation principle (ISP) states that no client should be forced to depend on methods it does not use.
D DIP
Dependency inversion principle
 That directly depends on one of the implementation classes is the Main class, which instantiates a moveLandVehicle object and moveAirVehicle.
